answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for posting.There is a possibility that you are suffering from tension headaches. However it is also important to rule out cervical conditions like cervical spondylosis and disc prolapse. Other causes can be acute anxiety and like you have mentioned extreme stress.I would suggest you to do some relaxation exercises everyday like breathing exercises and meditation.It is also important to rule out stroke since you have one sided facial and toe numbness.Do you have any risk factors for stroke like high BP, diabetes, high cholesterol or obesity?I would suggest you to consult your PCP and it would make sense to get an MRI done to rule out neurological causes like stroke.Take care!

question: I am 35 years old and suffer from constant headaches.  If I have any kind of stress, I start to get headaches at least 2-3 times a week.  They have gotten worse over the years.  When I experience my headaches, the right side of my face goes numb.  I could draw a line straight down my face where the pain is located.  Usually, the headache is above my eye, base of my neck on one side, upper shoulder on right side, and the top of of right side of my head.  I have come to a point that I do not like to drive when I have these headaches.  I cannot focus or remember things when I have the headache.  Within the last several years, my ears, especially my left side, feel like they are feel of fluid.  It feels like the fluid is moving around.  Also, a few of my toes on the right side go numb.  I cannot feel them that well.  I am worried, but I do not want to go to the doctor and be told to just take over the counter headache medicine.  It has become harder and harder to work.I am worried that it is something serious.  Should I be worried about this?  Can I request an MRI or do I have to wait for a doctor's recommendation?
title: Headaches
